title: YGGDRASIL: KodamaSounds 5th Anniversary Album
price: Event Price: 3500 yen | Digital Price: 20â‚¬ / 3500 yen | Shop Price: 3500 yen + tax

description.en: The roots of the YGGDRASIL take shape and form, to create an ascension towards a new future. "YGGDRASIL" is KodamaSounds' 5th massive anniversary project, with the goal of celebrating the legacy and future of the circle. You will see familiar faces, maybe even some new ones. We just hope the sprout of this tree will grow larger and prettier as time goes on, and that you will be able to reminisce and discover new grounds. We hope you can feel the creativity of this tree carrying your feelings for you alongside ours.

What goes on in my mind
When I write a song? Let me tell you.
The very first thing I do is write the melody.
I write it down with a staff paper in front of me.
If I play the piano, my fingers fall into old habits,
If I get stuck in a rut,
I feel like, "Oh, my life is over,"
A feeling of hitting rock bottom.
Ah, you may laugh, but songwriting
Once the melody is written, I move on to arranging.
I program the drums to fit the song's length.
When the rhythm section is solid, I'm happy!
What sound should I choose for the main melody?
The face of the song, it's the most important part.
I spend a whole day on just one sound,
"Why am I stuck in a rut here?" Wow
Making a living through music is a happy thing.
I know that, but songwriting is difficult.

â€¢ About this track: You feel the wind of inspiration lifting you, carrying you gently as you run forward across the green landscape. For a fleeting moment, everything is alright. Right now, you can fly.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: KodamaSounds means a lot to me, and I have truly enjoyed seeing it grow over the past five years. As a founder and manager of Resonant Union, I can truly relate to the struggles and challenges, as well as the victories and joys of organising a group like this. I feel it's truly a privilege to get to be part of a community like this. Thank you for having me. Here's to five more excellent years!

03.title: The Rhodadendron

â€¢ About this track: This composition contains two jigs that I wrote which I call The Leaf (in G) and The Cardboard Box (in Am). The overall structure is inspired by Irish session tune sets in which tunes are strung together back to back. In this case, there is some introductory material that leads into the first tune, The Leaf, which flows directly into The Cardboard Box, and then transitions into the ending material via the ever sweet Am to A major key change.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: KodamaSounds projects are always really nicely themed and there's nice variety in projects. The artists that come together to participate on these projects are great, so it's fun to be a part of it.

05.title: Entanglement
description: Please check the track's individual link on Bandcamp for detailed credits.
â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Michael Stokol (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Produced & Mixed by Michael Stokol (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Used Software: MuseScore, Logic Pro

â€¢ About this track: I wrote this piece back in 2023 during my music studies at The University of Melbourne. The music specialisations on offer at my university included Classical Performance, Jazz & Improvisation (J&I), Classical Composition, Interactive Composition (IC) and Musicology/Ethnomusicology. IC and J&I were originally courses offered by the former Victorian College of the Arts (VCA) curriculim, which has now been merged with the Melbourne Conservatorium of Music (MCM) at The University of Melbourne. Despite all these courses moving onto the same campus in 2019, students in the formerly VCA-based courses didn't often get the chance to interact with those studying under traditionally MCM-based courses, and vice versa. To oppose this arbitrary separation, I spent time making friends with students from the formerly VCA-based courses, and brought them together to create this piece. I invited two friends from IC, two friends from J&I and one friend from classical performance to play a piece that I, a classical composition student, composed for all of them. This piece represents this entanglement of disciplines that really arenâ€™t all that different from each other, and the collaboration of all of our creative voices; drawing from art music, jazz and other experimental influences.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I came to be involved with KodamaSounds via my activities with Resonant Union, as our contributing artists often participated on both groups' projects. I actually feel a bit bad since most of my conributions to KodamaSounds have been past works that I haven't found the opportunity to release independently ("leftovers" so to speak), and my submission for YGGDRASIL won't be any different, haha. That said, I'm truly grateful that Robin has been willing to accept and release these past compositions of mine on KodamaSounds' albums, and it's an honour to be part of such a large and growing group.
Key: C Minor (except for the final chord)

07.title: AL[ONE] - White Flower
description: â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Philip Saguil (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Philip Saguil (Resonant Union)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Sonuscore Lo-Ki Piano, Addictive Keys

â€¢ About this track: AL[ONE] - White Flower was the title screen music to a game project I worked on college. It was a 2D platformer about a struggle between humanity and the evolving field of androids set in a dying world. Nothing ever came of it, but I owe learning sound design to that experience. I have fond memories of improvising on my midi keyboard while working, which was the foundation for this piece. Fivda reached out to me asking if had any old tracks I'd like to use for this project, and together we decided this piece could be expanded into the state it is now. I hope you enjoy!

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I've had the pleasure of contributing to one Kodama album every year since 2022. I enjoy the original composition projects the circle releases under ECLECTIC RESONANCE, and I hope to contribute to more in the future! Building up Resonant Union next to KodamaSounds, I've always viewed this group as a sister to our own. I am very happy to see them reach larger audiences as the years continue on, and can't wait to see what they become in the future.

08.title: Per Past Pledges
description: â€¢ Composer, Arranger, Electric Guitar & Acoustic Guitar: YOKAI (KodamaSounds)
â€¢ Vocal Mixing & Mastering Engineer: KAYA
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Pianoteq 8, HALion sonic, Groove Agent SE 01, Ezbass

YOKAI: Itâ€™s the first time Iâ€™ve worked on a track with so many people, and it was a challenge both in terms of coordination and communication. I learned a lot from this project, and Iâ€™m very happy with the result because everyone gave their best. We supported each other even during the difficult moments, and I take away from this that, in the end, everyone genuinely wanted to create something good.

eili: Its always fun to contribute to fantasy-esque music. The unique blend of Fantasy and other modern elements, like JPop, and Rock, makes the song feel like a fresh take on a beloved genre. Having live instruments always brings more punch and a personal touch to songs. I personally love singing songs whose lyrics blend more than one language, coined or otherwise.

v1ris: It was such a joy to record violin for this song! YOKAI wrote such a beautiful, full-sounding string part for me to play. I always enjoy projects that call for the layering of several violin recordings to create a full section sound, and I think it turned out beautifully in the final production.
Volumetrique: Thanks for the opportunity to work on the instrumental mix! Happy to work with YOKAI again!!
â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project:

YOKAI: I arrived at Kodama two years ago now, but it feels like so much longer! This year has been the most important one for me, with the release of my third album under the circle. This album was even pressed and distributed in Japan! Itâ€™s a dream Iâ€™ve had for a long time, one I thought was unattainable until now but the stars aligned with the live presentation of the album for M3. One aspect I particularly appreciate about Kodama is the natural kindness of its members, a strong sense of mutual support and community that encourages you to push yourself further. Even though we compose on our own, there are always plenty of members available. Personally, I find this amazing because I love creating alone but surrounding myself with others when itâ€™s needed. A big thank you to Kodama for everything it brings me, both creatively and personally, in my own individual growth!
eili: I was really honored to be invited to such a special achievement. Anytime an indie studio sees success, it makes me just a little bit happier. I was glad to be a part of it.

v1ris: The online VGM community has changed my life, and KodamaSounds is absolutely an instrumental part of that since I've started getting involved with it over the past year! There are so many wonderful people I've met through it, and it's always an honor and a privilege to have contributed to its projects, whether I'm arranging/composing, or playing violin (which you can hear me play on YGGDRASIL!)

06.title: The Nine Worlds
description: â€¢ Composer & Arranger: Yumi Sakata (Holmgang ov Gensokyo)
â€¢ Electric Guitar & MIDI Piano: Yumi Sakata (Holmgang ov Gensokyo)
â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Yumi Sakata (Holmgang ov Gensokyo)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: ujam BEATMAKER, NI Spotlight Collection Ireland, EZDrummer 3, Sylenth1, Piano Colors, NOIRE Pure, Soundiron CORE Micro

â€¢ About this track: This spawned from an energy drink wired DAW session and the desire of defiance to the fact that YGGDRASIL is categorized into 4 different sections/styles. The result is a chaos like no other, and arguably my most ridiculous composition to date. 4 different drum kits, 3 different rhythm guitar tones, and many different piano/synth layers, the project looks just as chaotic as the music sounds. The title "The Nine Worlds", besides being an obvious reference to Yggdrasil, also refers to the roughly 9 different stylistic changes throughout the song, and the 9 musical references (memes) scattered about. Like I said, chaos. Either way, this is was genuinely fun to make and I hope you get a laugh out of this stupid track :)

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Kodama has always been the perfect place to really push my composition. Being part of the VGM arrangement scene, there's always this sense of limiting, be it genre wise, or making sure you can still hear parts of the original composition. With Kodama, even with the VGM arrangement projects, it always feels like it is encouraged to strive to push boundaries, even if it doesn't make sense. Yggdrasil, I feel, is the project that is really saying "go wild", and to have several artists on this project go wild is going to create something unforgettable. Happy 5th anniversary Kodama!!!

08.title: OMNIVERSAL CHRONOSENTIENT PARADOXICAL GUARDIAN
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Levc_EGM
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: RealEight (vst). Xpand!2 (vst). Ultimate Sound Bank Plugsound Box (vst). FPC, Soundfont Player and 3xosc (Fl studio Stock plugins). Megaman x 2 samples by daveeeey

â€¢ About this track: You are known as the "Droid" number 45. As the only fully CHRONOSENTIENT member of your team, you are the GUARDIAN of all timelines. Due to your enlightenment, you are virtually everywhere all of the time. You have therefore chosen to become a Monk of Fate, meaning that you never engage in conflict or directly intervene in anything that has, is or will ever happen. This is for the best, since while you're dealing with your friends, you're also having a lovely tea party with space bunnies, and witnessing an extensive battlefield too, among other things. Everything is happening around you all the time, which is why you find it hard to concentrate on anything, despite being good at multitasking. However, if you were to kick some hypothetical ass, which has never happened nor will it ever occur, this would play in the background.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Despite considering myself as the one that is always "out of place" in most albums, I was invited to contribute something to this special occasion. I was given this golden opportunity to make whatever my heart desires, and what it desires the most is "video game chaos"... So I did just that! (I don't think this solves my own problem of feeling out of place lmao.) In general, I haven't been in the best place mentally. I wrote a whole blog about how I "gave up" trying to reach people with my music. And yet, getting invited cheered me up enough to make something incredible, and I think that's the best thing about working with KodamaSounds. They're a group of people who love making music of all kinds. And that love is contagious, it inspires everyone to keep making music. I think that's what matters most. So despite my own self doubt, I made something that I think is great, the coolest song I've put together so far. And I hope everyone in KodamaSounds, including myself, keep making amazing music that inspires others forever.

description: â€¢ Composer, Arranger, Vocalist & Lyrics: Milkychan (Norowareta Night)
â€¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Milkychan (Norowareta Night)

â€¢ About this track: I always felt that lyrics were a place to put the feelings we might not want to say out loud, but then actually writing it down turns out to be incredibly hard, haha. Sometimes living becomes so much, you simply want to fall apart. But even then, until I go down eventually, I'd like to do the things I love and that have kept me going until now. That's the feeling I want to convey with this song. If there is something that ignites that certain spark in you, always hold it close.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Ever since this project started, I've been in awe of the sheer organizational power that is put on display. Putting out all of these amazing albums and bringing together so many people and their music is nothing short of impressive. I'd also like to give my personal thanks, because Kodama Albums are what got me out of terrible musical slumps which I may not have overcome by myself. Onto many more cool projects!

03.title: Amaranthine
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Nuchuu
â€¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Ample China Zheng, Ample China Erhu

â€¢ About this track: The lead melody is from a track I loved but I failed to know how to complete 5 years ago. I have revived that melody and finally given it a suitable expression in the form of Amaranthine: a celebration of that which does not fade. The track is inspired by the portion of Japanese Trance that fuses traditional instruments with the modern Trance, creating something both new and in respect to the old. The emotion of this track is inspired in part by the Shinto, Buddhist and Celtic beliefs in sacred nature, and the uncountable aspects worthy of respect.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: KodamaSounds publishes so many talented musicians, producers, alike, and it is with my whole heart I present Amaranthine to represent just a portion of KodamaSounds. I chose specifically a track I was passionate about, and one specifically I had failed to finish 5 years ago when I was much more new to music production, to bring back to life for KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary celebration. As reference to the divine nature of the mythological YGGDRASIL, I chose to represent forms of investment into divinity within my work. I also chose to combine new and old, as KodamaSounds does itself in its albums of wide varieties of music, and albums of celebrating modern culture. KodamaSounds was one of the first consistently professional quality music publishing groups I ever contributed to, and I am very grateful for these opportunities to make what I am passionate about alongside other talented musicians. May music connect us as YGGDRASIL connects the realms.

I'm honored to have had the opportunity to feature in previous albums, and to also have my track included in this ambitious project. Like most pursuits in life, making music has had its requisite share of ups and downsâ€”who knows if I'll still be doing this in another five years? But, like the title of my track, I'll strive first and foremost to continue to follow my heart, going wherever it goes. A myriad thanks to Fivda and the rest of the KodamaSounds staff for making all this possible, and here's to more great tunes and albums in the future!

07.title: arboreal amalgamation{op6_INITIATION}
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by HEAVYVIPER
â€¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Korg opsix mkII (hardware), Reason devices, DoruMalaia Voices03 ReFill
â€¢ About this track: Spend enough time among the trees and you'll find their roots intertwine with yours.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I have only contributed a few pieces to KodamaSounds projects at this point. Having started out in chiptune, I am very pleased to have been featured alongside the other spectacular artists on the "ECLECTIC RESONANCE Memories" albums. Having also been featured on the second "UPRISING" release, I can't say I feel I'm on the same level as other contributors, though the energy on display makes me want to get better! It's been wonderful to be associated with a circle that resonates such positive energy, and I'm always excited to see each new release. For YGGDRASIL, I tried not to come in with any preconception of what I should make. I did my best to sit down and let something come out. I had recently bought a Korg opsix as a hardware synth and controller, and decided to put it to work here. Almost all elements of the track, save for percussion and effects, were generated and recorded from the opsix. I usually work exclusively with softsynths, so the change of pace was invigorating! I ended up with something pretty airy, floating somewhere between techno and trance. I was expecting to make something harder if I'm honest, but perhaps I'm stuck in the clouds... I am at a point in my life where I am forced to balance my creative spirit with harsh realities and responsibilities. This circle has helped me maintain that balance. It's been a pleasure to contribute what I can, and I hope to do so well into the future. Happy 5th, KodamaSounds!! o(*ï¿£â–½ï¿£*)o

12.title: YESOD
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Yuutou
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: PS-20, Kontakt, Omnisphere, Vital, Groove Agent, Vexst Amen Break Drumkit, Jungle Jungle (1989 to 1999 Sample Pack), Ozone 9 Elements

â€¢ About this track: This track is heavily inspired by Foregone Destruction from Unreal Tournament. Since I've been through a lot these past few years, I wanted to make a song all about staying true to yourself despite adversity, so being inspired by something from my childhood definitely helped in that feeling. I decided to go with the name "Yesod" because its the foundation node of the kabbalistic tree of life and has sort of a balancing role. Having to balance yourself as you grow and experience harsher things while trying to keep your childhood memories and spirit as close to you as humanly possible is probably one of the greatest challenges to face in the modern day, it feels like it's so much easier to lose yourself with everything going on. It's always good to remember your roots and to stay as grounded as possible. Someday, I hope we can live in a world where everyone is happy and free. Let's fight for each other and for ourselves to make that future happen!

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I'm typically very shy when it comes to collaborating on albums that are group projects like this. I've wanted to participate more, but because of my poor memory and with how easily I get distracted, I keep forgetting. The same thing kind of happened with this song, I got invited and completely forgot until a month before it was due... (Â´âˆ€ï½€ï¼›) I like working with KodamaSounds though. Robin is very nice and understanding, and any time I'm able to participate, I do my best to. Everyone in the circle is so incredibly skilled at what they do, and every song I hear from the others blows me away! It keeps me inspired to get even better at music, I want to reach a point where my music elicits emotions from the people that listen to it. Everyone's been wearing tougher masks lately, but I've always wanted my music to be a cushion for people to relax and listen to, if only to be themselves for a moment. I'll do my best to keep getting even better, and I hope to continue to show up in more KodamaSounds projects in the future! Happy 5th anniversary!

13.title: __Lovely Brand New Hell__
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by LibriJamm
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Flex, Sylenth, Synthmaster3player free, Kontakt 7, Korg M1, Massive. Iota 2 Mini, Serum, Serum 2

â€¢ About this track: Originally this was meant to be an RPG battle theme. Specifically, for a tutorial section/area. Not for the very start of the game, it's too energetic for that.  But for like, Disk 2, after the protagonist has a full party and has gotten their shiny new power up that makes them extra super duper special. â€˜Cause special brand new powers means you gotta have special brand new enemies. Otherwise, things would be boring. And we don't want things to be boring...  right? Now, I'd say it's more of a character theme.  A happy little mantra of sorts. To get one through tough times. Mantra of what exactly? I dunnuh. It's a mystery. Anyway, With it originally being an RPG theme, it was supposed to be a quick 4 minute loop. But then around the 5 minute mark I shifted the bass a little more than I should've.  And like an idiot I went "Oooh that sounds nice, I should expand on that." And then BAM, suddenly it's 10 minutes long with almost no repeating sections. Establishing a melody? A distinct leitmotif? What's that mean?  Who knows? Certainly not me. Though, complaints aside, I guess it didn't turn out all that bad.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: Happy 5th Anniversary. Don't really have much to say here. I'm not the sentimental type. So in short, Thanks Ms. R for reaching out and gathering everyone together all those years ago. The project's really expanded huh. So when do we get lore? There needs to be a recommended album listening order. Thanks to the people conversing in the many group chats. I don't interact much with you, but I'm glad you're having fun and creating a welcome space for others. I'm sure that by being yourselves you are making someone else very happy. And thanks to the submissions team for putting up with me submitting songs on the exact due date. I swear I'm not doing this on purpose. I do start them months in advance. But it just keeps happening. ...Eto blehh
Almost there, no turning back now.

The team's faltering, I can see that clearly.

I know, we can make a world where we don't have to live in fear.
We can make a world, where people like us aren't sent out to die.

Just hold out a little bit longer.
We're almost there. I swear it.

I'll do what I do best.

08.title: GODHOOD
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Monochrome
â€¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)

â€¢ About this track: My track began life intended for an album that released back in April 2025. I didn't feel like what I was making fit the general theme of that album, so I shelved it, hoping to find a use for it in a solo original album release. But my solo music took a backseat this year due to my growing commitments to remix collectives and game soundtrack work. Any self-released album that this track could have been included on never came to fruition, and no community albums had a theme that easily accommodated this. Enter YGGDRASIL, with which I largely had creative freedom to approach the project how I wanted. The status and exclusivity of the album pushed me to do more with the WIP than I otherwise would have, and what started as a minute-long sketch blossomed into 6 minutes of drum & bass and artcore sounds. To me, the relentless intensity evokes a battle to achieve some sort of divine power. I hope my track gives anybody listening the feeling that they can do anything, that they can even attain GODHOOD.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I first learned about KodamaSounds in 2023 when I stumbled across a Twitter post from them. At this time, I had only a few months ago decided I wanted to pursue music composition professionally, and I was looking for communities I could contribute to, so I could build a portfolio. At the tail end of 2023, I made my first KodamaSounds appearance on Katamania!! -a Katamari tribute album-. Since then, I've gotten heavily involved in Kodama's albums. The ECLECTIC RESONANCE series in particular has been an immensely fun and valuable challenge in diversifying my portfolio and skillset, and I've greatly enjoyed maintaining a streak of appearances (up until Memories 2, so sad). Every album theme has given me new inspiration and new avenues of exploring and refining my sound, and I unquestionably would not be the musician I am today without the consistency of Kodama's projects. 2 years after my first Kodama appearance, I'm back once again to deliver a track for this 5th anniversary album. In terms of both my prowess and my career, a lot has changed in that relatively short time. I am the most confident producer I can be right now, and I have notable game composing credits to my name, which seemed a distant impossibility back in 2023. The journey to these achievements was made with KodamaSounds being a constant spotlight on my portfolio. I'm proud to be a small piece of the circle's history, enough to have the privilege of being on YGGDRASIL.
BPM: 175, gradually slows down to 150 but only at the very end

15.title: fundamentally dysfunctional
description: â€¢ Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Fivda (KodamaSounds)
â€¢ Additional Programming (Closing Piano Chords): trailmix37 (KodamaSounds)
â€¢ Mastering Engineer: malicent (Cursed Monastery / Sigillum Azoetia)
â€¢ Used VSTs & Samples: Vital, Serum, kHs Suite, Rea VSTs, TAL Reverb, Pro-Q 3, HTS Hypertrance Sample Packs, Supire Enigmatic Sample

â€¢ About this track: I started working on this song since... Early 2024. I thought to myself, just two days away from the true final song submission deadline, "well, there's no way i'll see myself being content with finishing this song when I'll actually get better." so there was hardly any better time than to submit it for YGGDRASIL, which is a project about growth and reflection on the past. This song represents a lot of negative feelings, which I've struggled with for quite some time now - mainly jealousy, greed, envy, grief, a lot of other raw emotions, and the general sense of being unable to do and be what I strive to be. Ever since I started working on this track, 2024 was definitely a turning point in my life, and a lot happened - mostly good things, for a change. 2025 was very stressful, eventful, busy and fragile in comparison. I think a good half of this song was represented fairly well within this track, for what it's worth. The frenchcore/IDM drop part is definitely my proudest work in sound expression so far, although the song still greatly suffers from abrupt structure changes and a lack of actual sound design/composition craft. The gibberish of voices we hear at the end is a lot of those keywords (emotions) I mentionned above, in different languages, that I've recorded and altered myself. It's a corny and cheesy way of expressing such feelings, especially with the distortion and invasive effects, but it has its charm and gets the point across. I really wanted to create a song that could truly feel "overwhelming", but at the same time, I wanted to give it a monotoneous/accelerating techno twist to feel like you're running out of breath. I wouldn't call this song my magnum opus, but it's definitely a track I wanted to complete one day, and I think it's an important part of myself that I somewhat managed to put on paper in some way. I have so many ideas, so much i want to express, and I feel like I've reached the apex of what I can accomplish without training further and... Actually making more efforts into crafting something truly meaningful. I don't think it's perfectionnism speaking, I just strictly feel like I cannot do what I truly want to make at all without putting in the efforts to do it. But... Yeah, my difficulties in learning, and accepting myself make it really difficult. Hence the track name, "fundamentally dysfunctional", which represents not only some issues in my psyche/way of communicating with others, but also about facing bewilderment when trying to craft something that truly feels like "you". You know what? Let's accept this song as a success in self expresison, for once. It's what truly matters in the end, isn't it.

â€¢ About KodamaSounds' 5th Anniversary / YGGDRASIL's project: I've always lived a hectic life of art and creativity. Every few years, my tastes change greatly, and so do my projects. Years back, I don't think I could imagine myself in the position I am today. I think I can confidently say that KodamaSounds is the best thing I've ever created of my life. It's insane to me that we've gone this far, and there is no sign of stopping. It has made me meet hundreds of amazing friends and artists, and it made me learn from my mistakes and successes to grow better as a person. Although there was growth and progress, it's still really hard to say I live the kind of life I wish I was living. YGGDRASIL is all about acceptance, growth, getting better, reflecting, and moving on. I hope you can listen to this album with as much awe as I do, and that this album will make you feel a connection with each and everyone's hard work and sweat in some form. People live, people create, people die, people grief, and other people will carry your name forever in your heart - be it through art or acts of kindness. I hope that in the same way, my name and KodamaSounds' will always be remembered by at least one person. I hope that everyone lives a brighter day and future, and that through hard and dark times, we shall carry lights and memories that will shine as bright as our creative souls will make them. I am eternally thankful to all of the artists that have trusted me, and helped me make this dream a reality. I am looking forward to the future in a way I couldn't have ever imagined. Thank you! #KODAMASWEEP
